posts.post_content: "Suicide black" is the first thing I thought of when I saw the vampires in this set. The lacerator is an improved version of [carnophage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=carnophage), a key component of the old suicide black set. [Hatred](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hatred) and [Dark Ritual](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Ritual) aren't legal anymore, but I can definitely see vampire decks becoming extremely powerful in the new type II.
posts.html:
"Suicide black" is the first thing I thought of when I saw the vampires in this set. The lacerator is an improved version of carnophage, a key component of the old suicide black set. Hatred and Dark Ritual aren't legal anymore, but I can definitely see vampire decks becoming extremely powerful in the new type II.

Posted By: nineyears (12/17/2009 4:20:49 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Only {B} for a 2/2 creature? Don't be afraid to use it in the early game. Normally, it will deal 1 damage to you but 2 to your opponent! (It's a good Black creature.) And if he gets killed, then you don't get the -1 anymore. Good card, he can wear down the opponent to 10 life by himself and stop hurting you... and then you got yourself a 2/2 who only cost you 1 mana to play!
posts.html:
